content.description: A very cool face. Climb straight up the middle using good edges and side pulls. Crux is halfway up.
content.location: From Spelunker walk east and slightly downhill for 15 seconds.

content.description: Start low on two underclings and a massive foot. Move diagonally up the face on tenuous feet and good crack system to a casual, but fun finish. A very unique climb. This would be 3 stars if not for the dabby start and un-protectable landing.
content.protection: Probably don't want to fall backwards, ever. You can always bail on the route by sticking a foot behind you, though if you were to take a fall you could would likely roll back into the cave.
content.location: 15 seconds down the hill from Perscrutation. The cave entrance faces east.

content.description: Start on sharp left hand undercling and small right hand crimp. Make a big move and then, using compression, continue up the face.
content.location:
Park in the CCC lot and walk east down the road to the bridge. Walk 30 seconds past the bridge and cut into the woods to find a talus field. Head up and slightly left (west). Aim for the second, higher up talus field. As you work your way through the second talus field, look off to the right (east) for a large pillar. Head to and around that pillar and you will find a very obvious social trail that leads you to this boulder. I believe this is the Poison Ivy Wall area.  

  -GPS: 43.41229N 89.70620W

content.description: Sit start on a good left hand rail and right hand edge. Do a couple of big moves on small holds to gain the compression features of the arete and continue to an easy topout. Tom insisted this be called "Joel's Little Pine Tree."
The left face of the same boulder as "Perscrutation." Start in the pit with two slopey compressions on the arete. Continue to use both aretes and some muscle to move up the face.
A striking tower below the right end of Poison Ivy Wall, and other miscellaneous outcrops above Juniper Wall.See East Bluff 03 - West of the Quarry for roped climbs in the area.
